snippet: A plan finalized Tuesday night comes just eight months after Mr. Morales, Bolivia’s first indigenous president, won a third term.
abstract: Supporters of Bolivian president Evo Morales, who is serving third term, seek Constitutional amendment allowing him to run again in 2020; country's first indigenous leader would face referendum if two-thirds of Congress, which is controlled by his backers, passes legislation.
lead_paragraph: A plan finalized Tuesday night comes just eight months after Mr. Morales, Bolivia’s first indigenous president, won a third term.

headline.main: Bolivia: President’s Supporters Aim to Alter Constitution to Allow 4th Term
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Bolivia: President’s Supporters Aim to Alter Constitution to Allow 4th Term
